cachepolicylabel

Configuration for cache policy label resource.

Read/write properties

labelname<String>

Name for the label. Must begin with an ASCII alphabetic or underscore (_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore, hash (#), period (.), space, colon (:), at (@), equals (=), and hyphen (-) characters. Can be changed after the label is created.

evaluates<String>

When to evaluate policies bound to this label: request-time or response-time.
Possible values = REQ, RES, MSSQL_REQ, MSSQL_RES, MYSQL_REQ, MYSQL_RES

newname<String>

New name for the cache-policy label. Must begin with an ASCII alphabetic or underscore (_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore, hash (#), period (.), space, colon (:), at (@), equals (=), and hyphen (-) characters.
Minimum length = 1

Read only properties

numpol<Double>

Number of polices bound to label.

hits<Double>

Number of times policy label was invoked.

priority<Double>

Specifies the priority of the policy.

gotopriorityexpression<String>

Expression specifying the priority of the next policy which will get evaluated if the current policy rule evaluates to TRUE.

labeltype<String>

Type of policy label to invoke: an unnamed label associated with a virtual server, or user-defined policy label.
Possible values = reqvserver, resvserver, policylabel

invoke_labelname<String>

Name of the policy label to invoke if the current policy rule evaluates to TRUE.

flowtype<Double>

Flowtype of the bound cache policy.

builtin<String[]>

.
Possible values = MODIFIABLE, DELETABLE, IMMUTABLE

__count<Double>

count parameter

Operations

NOTE: In request payload, Mandatory parameters are marked red and bold.

The following parameters can be used in the nitro request :

warning   <String_value>

Specify to get warnings in nitro response. If this field is set to YES, warning message will be sent in 'message' field and 'WARNING' value is set in severity field of the response in case there is a warning.
Other possible values for severity are ERROR, INFO and NONE.
Default value: NO
Possible values = YES, NO

onerror   <String_value>

Use this parameter to set the onerror status for nitro request. Applicable only for bulk requests.
Default value: EXIT
Possible values = EXIT, CONTINUE, ROLLBACK

adddeleteget (all)getcountrename

add

URL:http://<NSIP>/nitro/v1/config/

HTTP Method:POST

Request Payload:JSON

object={
"params":{
      "warning":<String_value>,
      "onerror":<String_value>
},
"sessionid":"##sessionid",
"cachepolicylabel":{
      "labelname":<String_value>,
      "evaluates":<String_value>,
}}

Response Payload:JSON

{ "errorcode": 0, "message": "Done", "severity": <String_value> }

delete

URL:http://<NSIP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel/labelname_value<String>

Query-parameters:

warning

http://<NS_IP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel/labelname_value<String>?warning=yes

Use this query parameter to get warnings in nitro response. If this field is set to YES, warning message will be sent in 'message' field and 'WARNING' value is set in severity field of the response in case there is a warning. Other possible values for severity are ERROR, INFO and NONE.

HTTP Method:DELETE

Response Payload:JSON

{ "errorcode": 0, "message": "Done", "severity": <String_value> }

rename

URL:http://<NSIP>/nitro/v1/config/

HTTP Method:POST

Request Payload:JSON

object={
"params":{
      "warning":<String_value>,
      "onerror":<String_value>,
      "action":"rename"
},
"sessionid":"##sessionid",
"cachepolicylabel":{
      "labelname":<String_value>,
      "newname":<String_value>,
}}

Response Payload:JSON

{ "errorcode": 0, "message": "Done", "severity": <String_value> }

get (all)

URL:http://<NSIP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel

Query-parameters:

filter

http://<NSIP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel?filter=property-name1:property-val1,property-name2:property-val2

Use this query-parameter to get the filtered set of cachepolicylabel resources configured on NetScaler.Filtering can be done on any of the properties of the resource.

view

http://<NS_IP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel?view=summary

Use this query-parameter to get the summary output of cachepolicylabel resources configured on NetScaler.

pagesize=#no&pageno=#no

http://<NS_IP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel?pagesize=#no&pageno=#no

Use this query-parameter to get the cachepolicylabel resources in chunks.

warning

http://<NS_IP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel?warning=yes

Use this query parameter to get warnings in nitro response. If this field is set to YES, warning message will be sent in 'message' field and 'WARNING' value is set in severity field of the response in case there is a warning. Other possible values for severity are ERROR, INFO and NONE.

HTTP Method:GET

Response Payload:JSON

{ "errorcode": 0, "message": "Done", "severity": <String_value>, "cachepolicylabel": [ {
      "labelname":<String_value>,
      "evaluates":<String_value>,
      "numpol":<Double_value>,
      "hits":<Double_value>,
      "priority":<Double_value>,
      "gotopriorityexpression":<String_value>,
      "labeltype":<String_value>,
      "invoke_labelname":<String_value>,
      "flowtype":<Double_value>,
      "builtin":<String[]_value>

}]}

get

URL:http://<NS_IP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel/labelname_value<String>

HTTP Method:GET

Response Payload:JSON

{ "errorcode": 0, "message": "Done", "cachepolicylabel": [ {
      "labelname":<String_value>,
      "evaluates":<String_value>,
      "numpol":<Double_value>,
      "hits":<Double_value>,
      "priority":<Double_value>,
      "gotopriorityexpression":<String_value>,
      "labeltype":<String_value>,
      "invoke_labelname":<String_value>,
      "flowtype":<Double_value>,
      "builtin":<String[]_value>

}]}

count

URL:http://<NS_IP>/nitro/v1/config/cachepolicylabel?count=yes

HTTP Method:GET

Response Payload:JSON

{ "errorcode": 0, "message": "Done",cachepolicylabel: [ { "__count": "#no"} ] }
